docs.text: Example: Import files raynamharris/r4rnaseq#1 Use read.csv() with default setting to import sample files. samples <- read.csv("./data/samples.csv") When importing the counts, specify row.names = 1 to set the Ensemble IDs as the row names. counts <- read.csv("./data/countData.HEART.csv", row.names = 1) Use read.table() to import tab separate files. results <- read.table("./data/GTEx_Heart_20-29_vs_50-59.tsv") Categories This example belongs to the following categories: Functions from the base R package
docs.title: Example: Import files

docs.text: raynamharris/r4rnaseq#1 Use read.csv() with default setting to import sample files. samples <- read.csv("./data/samples.csv") When importing the counts, specify row.names = 1 to set the Ensemble IDs as the row names. counts <- read.csv("./data/countData.HEART.csv", row.names = 1) Use read.table() to import tab separate files. results <- read.table("./data/GTEx_Heart_20-29_vs_50-59.tsv")
docs.title: Example: Import files

docs.text: This example belongs to the following categories: Functions from the base R package
docs.title: Categories

docs.text: Example: Make a volcano plot raynamharris/r4rnaseq#2 Volcano plots are a particular type of scatter plot used for show the log fold change and p-value of genes analyzed in an RNA-Seq experiment. The log fold change (logFC) is plotted on the X axis while the inverse log of the adjusted p-value (adj.P.Val, corrected for multiple hypothesis testing) is on the Y axis. We can use geom_hline() to draw a line on the plot to show adj.P.Val < 0.05. WE can use ifelse() to color points above and below the p-value threshold. Finally, we can rename the legend and provide a subtitle for the plot. ggplot(results, aes(x = logFC, y = -log10(adj.P.Val))) + geom_point(aes(color = ifelse( adj.P.Val < 0.05, "p < 0.05", "NS"))) + geom_hline(yintercept = -log10(0.05)) + theme(legend.position = "bottom") + labs(color = "20-29 vs 50-59 year olds", subtitle = "Heart Tissue Gene Expression") Categories This example belongs to the following categories: Functions from ggplot2 package
docs.title: Example: Make a volcano plot

docs.text: raynamharris/r4rnaseq#2 Volcano plots are a particular type of scatter plot used for show the log fold change and p-value of genes analyzed in an RNA-Seq experiment. The log fold change (logFC) is plotted on the X axis while the inverse log of the adjusted p-value (adj.P.Val, corrected for multiple hypothesis testing) is on the Y axis. We can use geom_hline() to draw a line on the plot to show adj.P.Val < 0.05. WE can use ifelse() to color points above and below the p-value threshold. Finally, we can rename the legend and provide a subtitle for the plot. ggplot(results, aes(x = logFC, y = -log10(adj.P.Val))) + geom_point(aes(color = ifelse( adj.P.Val < 0.05, "p < 0.05", "NS"))) + geom_hline(yintercept = -log10(0.05)) + theme(legend.position = "bottom") + labs(color = "20-29 vs 50-59 year olds", subtitle = "Heart Tissue Gene Expression")
docs.title: Example: Make a volcano plot

docs.title: Categories

docs.text: Example: Make a box plot raynamharris/r4rnaseq#3 After tidying, lengthening, and joining 3 data frames, we can make a box plot of differentially expressed genes. Use facet_wrap() to generate a plot for each gene, use theme() to change the font angle and face. Use scale_y_log10(labels = label_number_si()) modify the y axis. counts_tidy_long_joined %>% ggplot(aes(x = AGE, y = counts)) + geom_boxplot() + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~name, scales = "free_y") + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), strip.text = element_text(face = "italic")) + scale_y_log10(labels = label_number_si()) Categories This example belongs to the following categories: Functions from ggplot2 package Functions from scales package
docs.title: Example: Make a box plot

docs.text: raynamharris/r4rnaseq#3 After tidying, lengthening, and joining 3 data frames, we can make a box plot of differentially expressed genes. Use facet_wrap() to generate a plot for each gene, use theme() to change the font angle and face. Use scale_y_log10(labels = label_number_si()) modify the y axis. counts_tidy_long_joined %>% ggplot(aes(x = AGE, y = counts)) + geom_boxplot() + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~name, scales = "free_y") + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), strip.text = element_text(face = "italic")) + scale_y_log10(labels = label_number_si())
docs.title: Example: Make a box plot
